intro: Lagenantha gillettii, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous areas. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
